intro: Pristimera glaga, commonly known as the glag apple or glag tree, is a rare and ancient plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall, characterized by its rough, fissured bark and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by edible fruits that are yellow or orange in color. Pristimera glaga is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. It is also considered a living fossil, with a lineage dating back to the Tertiary period.
